actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to repeal the Gun Control Act of 1968, to reenact the Federal Firearms Act, to make the use of a firearm to commit certain felonies a Federal crime where that use violates State law.

summary.text: Repeals the Gun Control Act of 1968 and reenacts the Federal Firearms Act. Provides that whoever uses a firearm to commit any felony which may be prosecuted in a court of the United States, or carries a firearm unlawfully during the commission of any felony which may be prosecuted in a court of the United States, or uses a firearm to commit any felony, or carries a firearm unlawfully during the commission of any felony, which use or carrying for the purpose is unlawful according to the law of the State in which it occurs, shall, in addition to the punishment provided for the commission of the felony, be sentenced to a term of imprisonment for not less than one year nor more than ten years. Declares that for second or subsequent offenders (1) the imposition of any term of imprisonment under this Act may not be suspended; (2) probationary sentences may not be granted; and (3) any term of imprisonment imposed under this Act may not run concurrently.

titles.title: A bill to repeal the Gun Control Act of 1968, to reenact the Federal Firearms Act, to make the use of a firearm to commit certain felonies a Federal crime where that use violates State law.
